articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin, Dave Graham
articles.description: A huge chunk of a glacier in the Swiss Alps broke off on Wednesday, causing a deluge of ice, mud and rock that buried most of a mountain village that had been evacuated due to the risk of a rockslide, authorities said.
articles.title: Mud and rock bury Swiss village after glacier collapse, one person missing

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth, Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A U.S. federal trade court ruled the president overstepped his authority by imposing across-the-board duties on imports from nations that sell more to the US than they buy.
articles.title: US court blocks Trump's sweeping tariffs, citing overreach of authority

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Koreans began turning out in record numbers for early voting on Thursday in the country's snap presidential polls set to take place next week, election commission data showed, as both of the leading candidates cast their ballots.
articles.title: South Koreans turn out in record numbers for early voting in presidential election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday that Israel had eliminated Hamas Gaza chief Mohammad Sinwar, one of its most wanted targets and the younger brother of the deceased group's leader, Yahya Sinwar.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Hamas Gaza chief Mohammad Sinwar has been eliminated

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy, Keith Kellogg, on Wednesday scolded a top Russian official for stoking fears of World War Three after Trump warned President Vladimir Putin was playing with fire over Ukraine.
articles.title: U.S. scolds Russia for stoking WW3 fears after Trump's 'playing with fire' remark

articles.author: Ed White
articles.description: Manitoba declared a state of emergency and urged thousands of people in northern and eastern parts of the province to evacuate on Wednesday, as wildfires spread in Central and Western Canada.
articles.title: Manitoba urges thousands to evacuate as Canada wildfires spread

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that China has no right to object to or interfere with the Philippines' lawful and routine activities in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippines says China has no right to object or interfere with its 'lawful' activities in South China Sea

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government hit back at growing international pressure over the war in Gaza on Wednesday, amid deepening signs of division over the war at home, 600 days after the Hamas-led attack on October 7, 2023.
articles.title: Israeli government hits back as international pressure over Gaza mounts

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: U.N. trucks delivering food to Gaza were stopped and looted overnight, Gaza residents and merchants said on Wednesday, hours after desperate Palestinians overran a distribution site run by a U.S.-backed group trying to start delivering aid.
articles.title: Food trucks in Gaza raided, underscoring aid distribution problems

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Economist's latest printed edition for Asia featuring Vietnam's top leader To Lam on its cover has been banned in Vietnam, sources at two local media distributors told Reuters, in a new instance of censorship in the Communist-run country.
articles.title: Hanoi bans The Economist's printed issue with Vietnam's top leader on cover, say distributor sources
